column1: What will President Biden’s approval rating be as of 13 August 2021, according to FiveThirtyEight?
column5: ['Lower than 45.0%', 'Between 45.0% and 50.0%, inclusive', 'Higher than 50.0% but lower than 55.0%', '55.0% or higher']
column6: ['US Politics']
column11: The outcome will be determined using "All polls" data provided by FiveThirtyEight's "How [un]popular is Joe Biden?" page (FiveThirtyEight). As of 3 May 2021, Biden's approval rating was 53.5%. The data will be accessed for resolution on 16 August 2021.

column6: It's past midnight EDST. I will be surprised if there's any additional updating.
Question closes Friday, 8/13/21, with 538's polling data (presumably) for that day "accessed" on Monday, 8/16/21. So one more day of new polls - if any - on 538, it seems to me.

Wow! this one turned out to be exciting down to the wire. I do know for certain that Biden's approval will dip very seriously eventually, but this is still very early in his administration. Looking at past all Presidents have had troubles. What's different with Obama, Trump and now Biden is smoother. More people stubbornly dug in - before people looked at what was going on and make judgement about the president - so more up and down according to what was happening.

Somehow stopped the slide. 50.2% today and seems to be trending there. I panicked a week ago when he suddenly shed 1.3% between 8/1 and 8/6, but I'd be insanely shocked if he dipped because of anything today. If we do slip, I'll admit I was a bit too confident in this and lament that I missed the mark by such a small amount.

Going on the basis that the question closes in 11hours and the site has already been updated with today’s polls, so unlikely to see many new polls published before the question closes. So premise here is that the 50.2pc is the final result.
There are 4 letters to describe my thought-out rationale for this forecast: idfk.
Recent Fox News poll helped Joe out. https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-approval-rating/, https://www.realclearpolitics.com/epolls/other/president-biden-job-approval-7320.html
Ticked back up to 50.3!

SIMULATION: https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/biden_monte_carlo.py DATA : https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/approval.csv CURRENT APPROVAL INPUT: 50.3% EXPECTED APPROVAL OUTPUT: { "Lower than 45.0%": 0.00%, "Between 45.0% and 50.0%, inclusive": 36.86%, "Higher than 50.0% but lower than 55.0%": 63.14%, "55.0% or higher": 0.00% } NOTE: Simulation updated to reflect the appropriate evaluation date.

I don't know if any polls will come out between now and resolution but I'm wondering if maybe since the recent polls are all around 49 or 50 that another day or two could drop an older poll or two (likely with higher rating) out of the average, making bucket 2 most likely? Or perhaps that's not how it works and maybe it only drops old polls when new polls are released.

538's all-polls index is currently at 50.0 for Biden. Highly-'graded' recent YouGov and HarrisX polls measure Biden's approval rate at 48% and 50% respectively. (https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-approval-rating/) Real Clear Politics current poll average for Biden is 49.7 (https://www.realclearpolitics.com/epolls/other/president-biden-job-approval-7320.html)
At 50% as of August 11, 11:44AM; this is a nail biter!! With the top bin being inclusive I will place more weight there for the time being but could easily go either way now.
Revising to 70/30. Seems like he may squeeze through above 50%.
Disapproval went down which is a sign to me that things will stay the same or get better for Biden in the next several days. But I'd give this 2:1 odds.
Infrastructure package may help Biden beginning now. Will revisit forecast after (any) 538 update tomorrow
At 50.4% w/ 200 days worth of data Avg. DoD delta: +0.056% Largest swings: +3.81% / -3.683% 57/200 days constituting a drop that would satisfy "Between 45.0% and 50.0%, inclusive" -- 28.5%
With the historic $1Billion infrastructure bill passing the Senate, I believe Biden will most likely not slip below the 50% approval in the next few days.
50.2 . . .2 days until this closes. . . oh man, talk about a squeaker!
With only 3 days to go and a stable current approval, it is unlikely to change much.
just a few days left and ticked up slight the last couple days.
It crept up .2 today and the infrastructure bill is poised to pass the Senate tomorrow, so I'm hopeful it'll stay above 50% for the next week.
Holding steady above 50.

SIMULATION: https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/biden_monte_carlo.py DATA : https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/approval.csv CURRENT APPROVAL INPUT: 50.4% EXPECTED APPROVAL OUTPUT: { "Lower than 45.0%": 0.00%, "Between 45.0% and 50.0%, inclusive": 29.13%, "Higher than 50.0% but lower than 55.0%": 70.87%, "55.0% or higher": 0.00% } NOTE: Amazing! The simulation exactly matches the crowd forecast!
Down to 50.2% with 5 days left, looks like it'll be close
Adjusting towards the 45-50% number based on today's news from Afghanistan. His numbers are on the border now, and this will make them get worse - there is still enough time before resolution.
Getting close.
Just a little above 50% now, and falling.
Pre-delta variant driven surge in cases, would have assigned about two-thirds probability of rating between 50 and 55%.

The President's approval rating continues to drift lower due to changes in Covid cases, immigration and an uncertain economy. Americans appear to like President Biden but fewer Americans especially independents are willing to give President Biden the benefit of the doubt.
It's at 50.2% today (07. Aug). I think below or higher 50% are as likely.
I'm moving back up assuming the good economic report today will provide a bump in the final days.
This still depends on what polls come in in the next week. Some are definitely more negative in general than others, so there's increased chance of dipping under 50%

It's at 50.2 right now and trending downward. I was surprised at how much it has gone down, because partisanship is so strong these days, which had created a lot of resistance to going down too much or up too much, same as when Trump was president. Good article here on the situation, with some forces such as the delta variant and economic pessimism working against Biden's approval rating: https://cookpolitical.com/analysis/national/national-politics/bidens-ratings-slip-its-more-just-delta-fears

I'm surprised by his current rating. I expected it would fall, but I didn't foresee it falling so much in the last few days. I am thinking that it all hinges on COVID (does it get worse?) and infrastructure (will a bi-partisan bill pass?). My current forecast is way too strong considering how close his rating is to 50%. Dang!

Wow. At 50.2% as of Aug 6, pretty steep drop so suddenly. Given past % moves I'd say it's very close to 50/50 between the two buckets with a slight lean towards 50-55%. However, I'll take into consideration the crowd forecast and meet in the middle there so I don't get burned should it turn positive again. Will start to monitor this every day.
Americans are not happy about his policies on the Alaska pipeline, the handling of the pandemic nor the rising cost of living
https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-approval-rating/
The drop from the last two weeks was strong enough that it might dip under 50%, although it is likely just noise.

What a drop it has been. In 5 days the approval rating has dropped from 51.5% to 50.2% - shedding 1.3 percentage points. It's really not that much further downward and there has not been anything that's really under Biden's actual control at the moment causing this.

50.2, close to a coin flip. I think the momentum has some chance of continuing, as (rightly or wrongly) a surge in delta cases will weigh on favorability, as well as the increasing reaction to it (shot and mask mandates). On the other hand, very little time left.
The question closes in a week, and his popularity is falling. It will be close to 50%, but it's hard to determine which side at this point.

SIMULATION: https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/biden_monte_carlo.py DATA : https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/approval.csv CURRENT APPROVAL INPUT: 50.2% EXPECTED APPROVAL OUTPUT: { "Lower than 45.0%": 0.00%, "Between 45.0% and 50.0%, inclusive": 43.42%, "Higher than 50.0% but lower than 55.0%": 56.58%, "55.0% or higher": 0.00% } NOTE: kicking myself for not sticking with the simulation results from the start, but still putting my thumb on the scale to bias toward the crowd
With increasing disapproval, that may accelerate bin 1 and 2.

SIMULATION: https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/biden_monte_carlo.py DATA : https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/approval.csv NOTE: similar outcome to the simulation from this forecast: https://www.gjopen.com/comments/1316927

Dropped again. Think weighting’s and age are affecting current score and so as all the recent polls are close to 50pc we have to think it will keep dropping. Depends now on how many polls are published in the next week.
At 50.4. Given my volatility assumptions, it's about a 0.44 standard deviation move to get to 50.0 (note that the 45-50 bucket includes 50.0).

Don't quite understand the "blame Biden for COVID resurgence among the unvaccinated" (mainly in certain U.S. states), but will adjust some for currently dropping approval numbers: https://www.politico.com/news/2021/08/04/joe-biden-coronavirus-approval-rating-502439

This is exciting. Looks like it will be close. For so long it just didn't look like it was going to move much away from about 52%. I knew eventually his approval will plummet, but wasn't sure if by 13 August. But now it looks like it's headed to below 50%. And maybe below 45%!
I got to watch this closely because maybe will drop below 45%.
Holly cow! I've always been very sure his approval would drop precipitously, but not sure by 13 August. Finally people are waking up to what a total disaster this administration is.
Down to 50.6.

SIMULATION: https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/biden_monte_carlo.py DATA : https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/approval.csv CURRENT APPROVAL INPUT: 50.6% EXPECTED APPROVAL OUTPUT: { "Lower than 45.0%": 0.00%, "Between 45.0% and 50.0%, inclusive": 31.01%, "Higher than 50.0% but lower than 55.0%": 68.88%, "55.0% or higher": 0.11% } NOTE: Using the simulation as a guide, but biasing toward the crowd for my actual estimates.
Definitely not spiking to 55% or higher with the current state of affairs. I'm still very confident in 50-55%, but will keep 5% in the 45-50% range because we might dip just enough at the wrong time.
Baseline forecast based on current approval rating
As of 8/3/21 Biden's approval rating on 538 is 50.9% and while it is steadily decreasing the rate of fall is not sufficient to drop below 50% before 8/16/21

Maybe I'm just rationalizing an overreliance on recent data like I have in the past, but I'm bumping the <= 50 bucket a bit. Still a low outside rate, but I think I was underestimating the size of the effect from the delta variant surge in past forecasts to justify a higher 50-55% probability (https://www.gjopen.com/comments/1307905).

50.9 today and all the recent averages are close to 50pc. Not many recent dots over 50pc. 10 days to go and weighting if older, higher approval rates polls will reduce daily. Also the polls closer to 50pc have got greater weighting in the calcs. The 4 new polls today over 50pc are only just over 50pc and have a lower weighing than the recent under 50pc polls. It could drop below 50pc now. Of course depends on the polls in the next few days, but the trend is downwards.
https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-approval-rating/

His approval rating continues to fall. Depending on the two infrastructure bills, this could shift up a little bit, but with COVID weighing heavily on people, I think it's more likely that his rating will continue to fall, although I think he has a floor of support at or above 45%.

recently his approval rating has been decreasing and is approaching the 50% mark, so I think it'll be very close to 50% but am giving the edge to it staying above. https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-approval-rating/
Tick down to 51.1%
13 August not very far away.

SIMULATION: https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/biden_monte_carlo.py DATA : https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/approval.csv CURRENT APPROVAL INPUT: 51.1% EXPECTED APPROVAL OUTPUT: { "Lower than 45.0%": 0.00%, "Between 45.0% and 50.0%, inclusive": 19.38%, "Higher than 50.0% but lower than 55.0%": 80.13%, "55.0% or higher": 0.49% } NOTE: Using the simulation as a guide, but biasing toward the crowd for my actual estimates.

Adjusting back upwards, I've really waffled on this one. Delta has been playing out and we haven't seen a big enough effect on approval ratings to justify a lower bet. Linreg since 4/24 would put us at 51.2% on the close date, and there's only been one date in that 101 day timeframe with a gap between the actual value and the linreg of more than 1.2%. So outside rate from that approach would be 1%.
Roughly 1.25% standard deviation assumed over next 2 weeks

For July 30 its 51,5%. It has never been below 50% since election day, so it's highly unlikely that it will be below that in two weeks. It has been higher than 55% once (March 22), but looking at the numbers at the moment is seems virtually impossible.
Dropped to 51 per cent and falling. Not a lot of time left, but there are a number of issues that are reducing his popularity. A majority of the country thinks his policies are increasing inflation.
tightening while still balancing against the simulation I ran previously: https://www.gjopen.com/comments/1313413
I'm compensating for previous predictions. 13 August is not very far away and he's still at 51.5.
he will touch 40 by Jan 1
ticking down slightly to the full downside risk from the "outside view" from the simulation I ran previously: https://www.gjopen.com/comments/1313413
Tick down to 51.4. Rising mask debate isn’t going to help, and despite bipartisan infrastructure deal I think it’s close to impossible he get a large polling bump in next 2 weeks.

For the last six months it has always been between 50 and 55, so it would be completely surprising if it would not be in this margin in two and a half weeks. Rising Corona cases or an unforeseeable political conflict could be a challenge, but the probability is very low.

Attempting to take the baseline (he's been 51%<X<55% all year, but with a clearly visible, but mild drop off over time. I don't expect any legislative breakthrough before 8/16 that would reverse the slow decline in his approval. Hedging with a minor allocation to something volatile happening.
I see no developments in the next few weeks that will change the deeply entrenched parisan positions.

His approval seems fairly steady although it is dipping a bit. I think the risks of a catastrophic dip or increase in his ratings have essentially fallen to 0. The infrastructure deal announced yesterday may help a bit, but the increase in COVID cases and the soon to be announced vaccine mandate for federal workers could hurt him somewhat. Additionally, immigration is still a huge risk for Biden. Lastly, progressives are starting to get impatient for his American Families Plan and student debt cancellation (if or when it happens).

this is definitely a very interesting question. It looks like it could be close. I'm kind of surprise there could be so many who approve of Biden. He is a weak, demented, impotent leader and reminds me of Jimmy Carter. At this time Jimmy still had well over 60% approval. But after about a year his weakness showed through and he became very unpopular. Same thing will happen to Creepy Joe, but I think much worse.

SIMULATION: https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/biden_monte_carlo.py DATA : https://github.com/jonathanmann/gjopen/blob/master/biden_approval/approval.csv CURRENT APPROVAL INPUT: 51.89% EXPECTED APPROVAL OUTPUT: { "Lower than 45.0%": 0.01%, "Between 45.0% and 50.0%, inclusive": 13.06%, "Higher than 50.0% but lower than 55.0%": 83.69%, "55.0% or higher": 3.24% } NOTE: Using a starting approval of 51.89% and simulating a random walk based on Biden's approval fluctuations from now until August 13th gives a ~13% chance of an approval below 50% and a ~3% chance of an approval above 55%. This is a good start for an outside view, but I suspect partisan influences put a relatively low ceiling on Biden's approval, so I'll go with the crowd's lower 1% estimate. Similarly, I suspect Biden will have a relatively high floor, but this is probably more subject to erosion due to exogenous events, so I'll give the 45-50% bucket just a little bit higher odds than the crowd.
Update: If "hard" infrastructure bill is passed it may help Biden's larger agenda, etc. https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-government-and-politics-business-c5e6ce9620ad98687cabb678121042a3
May be able hang in there above 50% with less than three weeks to go in the question: https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-approval-rating/

I am lowering my forecast to reflect negative developments regarding the Biden Presidency--remember everything is the President's fault. Rising prices and coronavirus restrictions and cases will impact Biden's approval rating but I do not think it will be a sharp reduction as his base remains loyal and independents are divided. Death totals in Blue states are key.
Waiting to see what trend persists.

Approval rating has not been 55% since March and his recent slide has been reversed since the $300 child tax credits started hitting bank accounts. Definitely by far the most likely scenario for us which has been my opinion all along.
(This is compensating for prior forecasts. I'm currently posed to lose ~0.04 points or so when this resolves as 50-55 and I'm not convinced enough that the crowd is wrong.)
Tacking back to center to compensate earlier forecasts
Not trending down fast enough, still a chance with delta and all but looking less likely

The volatility in Biden's 538 approval rating is remarkably low. Ie, the 538 approval rating has been more stable than for most previous presidents. This is will partly caused by stability in Biden's approval rating, but also because 538 more polling data now than it did for previous presidents, leading to more stable estimates. The This increased stability could make for a more stable future forecast, especially as the forcasting timeline is only 3ish weeks outs. However, Biden's 538 approval rating rides much closer to the 50% boundary (currently 52%) than most previous presidential candidate, meaning that even a relatively minor negative event could tip him into the below 50% category. Moreover, the 538 approval has a negative drift, which increases the odds further. Without an explicit model, it is hard to factor come up with reliable estimates.
Time
Any news that would change his approval rating at this point would be a 9/11 style attack, stability is the name of the game.

Over next three weeks, assuming a 2 month 2.5% standard deviation, a move down to 50% would be a 1.67Z event. Skewing a bit, not really allowing much for the above 55% scenario given that that was the highest Biden has ever been and back then conditions were extremely supportive to him.
His approval rating is falling on 538, and Gallup shows an even greater drop. Lowering odds on being above 50%
sitting right in middle of 50.0 - 55.0% with only a few weeks before 13 August.

Well, I think 52% have the head up their rears. We have a president in bed with big tech censoring free speech. Throw out First Amendment. Hell, throw out the constitution. But my job here is to predict the approval rating of Biden and just looking at history so far, it's pretty certain it will stall in current bin: 50.0% - 55.0%.

Revising 50-55 up. He hasn't been out of that range since March 23rd (when he was higher). More probability to a break to the downside, since big negative event seems more likely than bit positive one.
Adjusted over time.

It's been 50.0% to 55.0% everyday since inauguration except for a couple times it was slightly above 55.0%. Outside of something dramatic happening, I don't see any chance going above 55.0. And now after more than 180 days still in middle of the 50 - 55 range.

23 days to go with 52.3% approval. His disapproval rating is pretty much stable for the past 4 weeks. And his approval rating was also overall stable, and never jumped (up or down) more than 2% in a period of about a month.
Due to strong partisanship momentums and the stability in Biden's rating so far, I would expect it with a very high probability to end up at 50%-55%, and I think the crowd odds of .83 are too low.

His approval has been relatively stable since the beginning of his presidency. I think his approval rating could only go down at this point. His approval has been hit by immigration, and the news that there were more migrants at the border in June, and a federal judge ruling DACA illegal will only put more pressure on Biden. https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/16/us/politics/migrant-families-homeland-security.html?searchResultPosition=1
Passage of time update
Uptick in numbers. Now you’d need a 2.5% decline in less than a month. Also on the margin China escalation will help rather than hurt him.
Like most presidential approval rating trend is downward ticking in first year (outside of extraneous events and incidents)

@rbauer2000 Does seem to me that your bias is affecting your forecast. However, it's helpful that you put your bias out there because it helps me to see other people's views on the topic. While I do not "despise" all those that you have mentioned, I see that you do.

It's going to be close. I strongly despise Biden and Harris and most of the whole woke crap Democratic party so that probably clouds my judgement on this. But it's fun to see his rating drop and it will drop well below 50% - I'm just not sure by 13 August. I'm compensation my earlier predictions where I'm not optimistic it will dip below 50%.
51.1%, falling, and about a month to go. It can change 1.0% in 3 days.

I knew his rating would dip below 50%, just don't know when. My inclination earlier was to predict so, but numbers seems to stick at around 52% for a while. Obama - a better president, more charismatic and being at least part black helps - but he dipped below 50% after about one year. I figure Biden has to faster. And really he is an awful president, babbles non-sense most of the time, is lost and confused most of the time, is creepy around young girls. Also, gas prices nearing $4/gallon, Mexican border crisis, inflation, lot more divisive politics, etc. etc. I just think a lot of leftist are being stubborn and not seeing how screwed up Biden and most of the Democratic Party is. Many leftist just don't want to see reality and cling to delusion that Biden, the Democratic Party and all this Woke crap is OK.

Currently at 51.2%, his low point. More strong economic news and the first disbursements of Child Tax Credits could make the number go up. Pretty much everything else could make it go down. We're in the age of thermostatic polarization so his approval rate should stay fairly steady, but there is more room to fall than increase.

51.2%, trended down as I expected. Given a 1.75% assumed monthly vol, the current probability of winding up lower than 50 is 25%, and above 55% is 1%. Skewing those numbers a bit as I think the trend is likely to continue given a lot of the easy benefits - like stimulus checks and vaccine rollout - are behind him. Also youre starting to see support erode from within the democratic base.

Looking at Biden data historically there's no chance that it would be below 50%, a Monte Carlo using historic changes has it below 50% <1% of the time, and a linear regression (it's not linear I know) puts it at above 51% if you use the slope starting from the current level. Something needs to change (or keep changing) for it to go below 50%. Approval did dip recently to around 52% (as low as 51.5%) though, so that may be the start of something. Outside rate here is probably 12% or so for below 50%, just due to ambiguity about the recent dip and chance of more change in the future. Getting an outside rate here is pretty difficult since the polling method used here only applies to like 3 presidents, and Biden hasn't been in office very long either.

Look at approval of past presidents on the fivethirtyeight page. Obama and Trump curve is pretty smooth. I think Biden will follow same. Many of the past presidents had drastic changes in their approval ratings at times, but those where always tied to big events. 9/11 with W. or Iraq invading Kuwait with H. W. or Ford pardoning Nixon or Clinton deciding it's a good idea to have affair with an intern or Reagan trying to fund "freedom fighters" with arms deals with Iran, etc.

At lowest point of presidency, 51.6%. Outside view: Normally 1.6% vol in approval ratings is very little even over a month, and most presidents have a decline in their first summer. Inside view: Inflation surging, most of the noticeable economic stimulus (like checks) behind us, and virus may pick back up though uncertain. On the flip side, the other inside view point is that Biden's propularity, like Trump's, is extremely not volatile.
Not much has happened to justify major changes to POTUS approval.

I think it's close to 50-50 but I am compensating for my past forecast that where too high or too optimistic for the 50% to 55% bucket. Biden's rating will dip below 50% eventually and perhaps 45%. He doesn't invoke strong emotions for or against, but is just a blah demented babbling boring incompetent president. Some people may even feel sorry for him.

Removed 3% from the top category and gave 2 to 50-55 and 1 to 45-50. No major changes. Don't see much affecting his approval rating, but watching in case we dip below 50% because that would drastically change the likelihood that we wind up there.
Media bias is on overdrive.
Honest forecast.
Looks like it will stay north of 50.0% long enough for 13 August. It will drop below 50.0%, but doesn't look like by 13 August.
https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-approval-rating/
Entrenched political views across the US
Approval goes down during presidency.
Opinions are very solidified so absent a dramatic domestic or international event there is little room for movement.
High variations are quite rare in a month of pool. If the trend keeps going, we'll be at ~51% so there's an important margin of variation that still makes the "Higher than 50%" answer true.
If my information is correct, President Biden is in the low 50's on the 4th of July. He probably doesn't have many opportunities for this to go up or down in the next month.
Recent polling data suggests he’s holding steady.
OK, I'm re-examing this. 13 August just a little more than month away.
I think there are many people who are very partisan and will say approve no matter how bad and demented Biden is.

Assuming a 2.5% stdev in approval every 2 months, with some skew to the downside as its hard to imagine Biden's approval eclipsing the march high of 55% when stimulus checks had just been issued and vaccination was accelerating.

Back to steady.
Reducing >50’based in this: https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/560866-biden-approval-at-55-percent-sees-decline-among-democrats-poll

Seems pretty stable since the inauguration, with a slight downtrend. I'm not aware of any potential political "surprises" for the average person in the next couple of months, but I don't follow politics so that's not saying much.
Biden is not doing anything to really hurt or help himself when it comes to his approval rating, just clam and steady.
His approval rating has remained fairly steady in the low to mid-50’s. Well there is a possibility that it goes above 55% before 8/13, I’m betting it stays between 50-55%.
Nudged up the last couple days.

538 shows a modest decline, so I am lowering the chance of upward movement, and increasing the chance of downward movement. His rating is pretty stable.
reducing the above 55% probability. He's hit that once and it was immediately after stimulus checks hit

seeing erosion in his support among democratic voters.

Testing Baye's.
A and D at zero simply reflects how rarely the approval curve has moved more than the 7% down or 4% up needed, reinforced by the unlikeliness of war or depression occurring unexpectedly.

There are about 100 days between May 03 and Aug 13 and we are close to 50 day mark. Biden's rating, at the time of writing this, is 51.7%- so it trended down about 2%. (from 53.5%). A big part of that, might be the "honey-moon period premium" wearing off, but it also brings the rating within striking distance to 50% and 50 days to go. This should slightly increase the b2 probability.
Seems like a booming economy will keep this <50%

Reduced chances of above 55% and below 45%. He has shed 1.7% over the past couple weeks, but I think it will take some effort for him to drop below 50% approval ratings. There are legislative wins he could get that would bolster him into the above 55% category but those are unlikely before mid-August. Will continue to monitor.

Adjusting to be more in line w/ the crowd. August 13 is less time than I originally thought and a massive change is unlikely before then. IMO it's far easier to lose support than gain so I will skew to the downside. This is especially true given the strenuous environment we are currently in both in foreign affairs as well as new Covid strains. On the other hand, ending Covid restrictions and the summer months are both positive catalysts. How positive? What if restrictions must be reimplemented?

The "Jun. 9-14 Monmouth University" poll seems to be on some kind of equilibrium point at the moment. Disapproval has been growing over the past 4 weeks. Biden was probably less convincing in the Geneva US-RU summit, his press conference ended very weird (he was probably tired and under stress due to the heat in the sun) and shouting at Kaitlan Collins (CNN) left a clumsy impression.
Edging close to 50pc. Not sure if the cause, probably just npbecuae nothing is changing quickly and it’s a bit quiet.

Biden's approval rating has been rising since April/May and his disapproval has been dropping virtually in correlation. This question seeks a percentage approval rating on a single day. Biden's rating has been within 50-55% on nearly every day since the start of his presidency. It may be that it is sometimes close to 55%, and it might briefly exceed 55% before August 13, but I have not found a reason that persuades me it is going to trend higher or lower and be outside this range on August 13 itself. Comparison to past presidents at this stage of their presidency does not seem that useful given the current (greater) degree of political polarization which may account for the stability of this approval rating. I looked only briefly, but did not notice any particular tendency for the polls (among those aggregated by 538) that are released just before the middle of a month to give Biden either a notably lower or higher rating (and of course any such impact would be limited).

Looking at Obama, he dipped below 50% after about one year after starting at 64%. Biden Started 53% and is a lot less charismatic than Obama and demented. Plus a lot of things going wrong. So I expect Biden to dip below 50% with one year of taking office, but unsure if by 13 August.

Risk, in my opinion is to the upside, however, two high datapoints will be falling off which will add roughly a point to the current 2% cushion. He is doing a masterclass in good politics. I expect he *will* crest 55% however, my expectation is that it will take past September to do.
Nudging up the 50-55% bracket because the approval rating is so stable

revised to include more doubt about the future. Still expect sentiment to rise with reopenings and reflect in approval, but lower probability. First 100 days approval has been very steady between 52.5 and 55%. Approval for Trump and Obama mostly resisted quick changes; Biden is centrist and a well-known politician and unlikely to rock the boat. His agenda through the summer is likely to continue to be focused on COVID, which he's handled without major gaffes. >>Status quo is most likely by far. It's possible the debate on unemployment extension redounds to his detriment, but I rate this as small.

So, seems the economy is still recovering, and more than half of the US population got vaccinated already. Hence, I don't think - considering the trends- his approval rating go bellow 50% till mid August. On the other hand, seems most of the disapproval is affected by the current gap between the two parties. Furthermore, "Almost all recent presidents have seen their approval ratings sink from their inauguration through the end of their first summer in office." Hence, it should stay around 52%.

Employment numbers and vacancies are up, the vaccination programme is reaching all those who want to receive it and short of a major social crisis in July /August the approval ratings should remain broadly steady.

So far Biden's approval is more stable than previous presidents, which might indicate that polarisation is entrenching people's approval survey choices - to change those survey choices it'd need to be a major event. This pushes me towards 50-55%.

One of the reporters from 538 Politics had and interesting interview on CNN over the weekend talking about new trends in presidential approval polling, which of course is rooted in our increasingly polarized partisan environment, where voters have increasing black and white hard opinion about public leaders. The reported basically stated the way Trump's approving could never broke 50% and was predominantly between 40% and 45% during his term, polling on Biden is showing the same trend, except for him the numbers are remaining between 50% and 55%. Something similar was seen for Obama, about 45% to 52%. The conclusion was that spikes and deep dips in public approval are going to become increasingly unlikely in the short term, barring massive global events, such as war or major scandals of the level never seen before in American politics or complete economic collapse.

With the extreme stability of approval ratings accross the last two us presidents, Joe Biden is a tested person in the US public eye and August is not far away. It is likely, that excepting a great event in us history, Joe Biden will remain in his 52-54% range.

Historically President's have had an above 50% approval rating. Trump was a rare exception. His approval rating has hit 55.0 twice, but not exceeded it. It has never been below 52.0% much less 50.0%. Because we seem to be in an age of incredibly stable favorability ratings, my best guess is that his approval will continue to largely be the reverse of Trump's, at least through August. Which means, probably won't go below 50% or above 55%, at least through August. Of course, there could be some major event, but hard to say whether, for example, war in the Middle East between Israel and some combination of Arab states/Palestinians would send his rating up or down, or affect it at all.
